definition: the sounding of a bell at evening

a regulation enjoining the withdrawal of usually specified persons (such as juveniles or military personnel) from the streets or the closing of business establishments or places of assembly at a stated hour
examples: The city ordered a curfew to prevent further rioting.

definition: a requirement that someone (typically a child) be home by a particular time
examples: Instead, [parents] should make a point of enforcing curfews and standards of behavior that reflect their family's values …

definition: a signal to announce the beginning of a curfew
the hour at which a curfew becomes effective
examples: Austerity has come to Rome, with a midnight curfew, car-less Sundays …
She began to cry because it was past curfew and she was certain her momma would kill her when she got home.

definition: the period during which a curfew is in effect
